result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Crystal B Sprenger in court with attorney Jeffrey John Siewert. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights. 
15CM198 - no contest plea to Counts 2, 3 & 5. 
15CM147 - no contest plea to Count 1. 
Court accepts her pleas and finds guilty. 
15CM198 - Counts 1, 4 & 6 dismissed and read in. 
15CM147 - Count 2 dismissed and read in. 
15CM191 - dismissed and read in. 
State has complied with victim notifications. 
Victim present. 
Recommendations by DA Snider and Atty Siewert. 
Statement by victim. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 2 years probation, concurrent on each count. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs, including DOMAB on 15CM147 
- supervision fees 
- submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate and abide by treatment recommendations 
- take medication only as prescribed 
- 10 hours community service work on 15CM198 Counts 2 & 5, consecutive, for a total of 20 hours 
Advised of appeal rights.
Atty. Siewert asked to reschedule, DA's office no objection.
Atty. Snider provided offer to Atty. Siewert needs to review with client
Rescheduled at the request of Atty. Snider

Defendant Crystal B Sprenger in court with attorney Jeffrey John Siewert. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Complaint received, reading waived, rights explained. 
Not guilty plea entered. 
$2,000 signature bond ordered with conditions covering 15CM191 & 15CM198. 
STC to be scheduled by Br. II.

***also covers 15CM198***
Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.
No verbal or physically abusive conduct with S. J. (dob 02/23/83)
